sub_title: Manager Expertise Functioneel Beheer at Gemeente Den Haag
summary:
For Frank, it was a logical choice to add Post HBO Business Administration as a study after studying HTS Information Technology. IT-systems are not a purpose for themselves, they should support customers and companies. Frank feels like a fish in the water when he can fulfill a bridge function between the business, the customer and the technology and when his creativity and sense of reality are called upon. Similarly, in situations where changes / projects are likely to get stuck.

Frank has shown in his Sales and BusinessDevelopment roles that he can listen to the customer, translate customer demand into suitable solutions and vice versa. 
Frank has led organizations with a budget responsibility of XX million Euro and a span of control of more than 200 FTE, spread over several (international) locations. He has demonstrated at the Ministry of Justice that he can manage complex environments on a content, organizational and political level. As Operational Manager he has shown that he can lead a large group of people, take responsibility in a dynamic work field and manage quality and profit margin.

His strengths include organizing, managing and motivating teams and colleagues and quickly familiarizing himself with the environment. Frank likes to make clear agreements, partly because of this he is an example for his team members. He picks up his responsibilities, even outside his domain, if this is necessary for the intended end result.

His colleagues characterize him as someone with lots of energy, who is reliable, transparent, assertive, easy to approach and creative. He is politically sensitive, respects others' opinions and is results-oriented.

Deng Xiaoping (1963): No matter if the cat is black or white, as long as it catches mice.

school.name: De Haagse Hogeschool / The Hague University of Applied Sciences

profile_positions.location: Ahold Delhaize, Zaandam area the Netherlands
profile_positions.description:
The daily activities of Frank consisted of managing store and multi-store escalations with various internal and external solutions. These escalations varied from a collapsed roof of a store to the failure of all cash registers in one or more stores.
Particularly due to the frequent roll-out of adjustments and new store concepts, which regularly caused large-scale incidents, it was necessary to initiate and manage temporary teams that had to solve the problems.
In addition to these daily activities, Frank also provided stand-by services for Ahold IT every 4 weeks. The scope of these stand-by services involved 2,200 stores (Albert Heijn, AHtoGo, Etos and Gall & Gall), 7 Distribution Centers and all other central IT components of Ahold.

Activities / results he has performed:
• Accompanying and resolving escalations,
• Guiding the new management party
• Realization of a new integral change process for the stores
• Due to my efforts, the MTTR has shrunk significantly and the number of escalations has decreased
profile_positions.title: Escalation Manager at Ahold Delhaize

profile_positions.location: Zoetermeer, Den Haag, Groningen, Mumbay, Pune
profile_positions.description:
As Manager Operations for KPN Mobile, Frank was responsible for KPN Mobile's maintenance contract. This contract was executed by various parties within Atos and third parties. Approximately 70-80% of the work was carried out in India, the other activities were carried out at KPN, third parties and at various (international) Atos locations. The span of control of our own employees was 200+ with a budget of around XX million per year. The various domains within the contract were process oriented, as were the associated KPIs. Solution times and availability were of course basic KPIs, but for the contract Business KPIs were also agreed, such as for example that a customer could leave the store calling within 5 minutes after signing his contract.
In between, Frank worked for 3 months on the start of a re-transition of the work from 90 FTE to an Indian party. This process had a difficult start because the definitions from the contract and the scope between KPN and the new party did not match what Atos and KPN had contracted at the time and had to transfer to the new party.

Activities / results he has performed:
• HR tasks,
• Re-transition for 90 FTEs,
• Implementation of the Atos GDP process,
• Profit and Loss responsibility and guidance on (business) KPIs and SLAs,
• Despite the reduction of the contract, Frank maintained the quality of the service as well as the profit margin.
• Responsibility for the implementation of the Maintenance Audit, which ensured that the quality of completion significantly increased.
profile_positions.title: Manager Operations at KPN Mobile

profile_positions.description:
The contract for KPN Mobile Billing was divided into 3 compartments, maintenance, changes and projects. 6 Dutch resources were drawn up for the changes and resources were hired from the Indian maintenance team. A confidence break had arisen between the Dutch and Indian team, resulting in a drop of profitability and a rise in lead time. The type of changes was medium- and large-sized and the average number of changes in progress was around 120 with a turnover of 10 million per year.

Frank was appointed as Innovation Manager to put the profitability and the turnaround time in order. The first task was to gain insight into the financial figures and what exactly played between the two teams. We started with a daily meeting to discuss the current changes and the work stock. After this, I took care of the work distribution and planning and re-entered the Atos processes.

Activities / results he has performed:
• Setting up profitability and lead time,
• Put badly running projects back on track,
• Re-implementation Atos GDP process.
profile_positions.title: Manager Innovation at KPN Mobile

profile_positions.description:
In 2002 Atos took over all management of hardware and software, including personnel, from KPN. Contracts were reviewed every 4 years. At the last contract negotiation, it was decided to transfer a large part of the technical and later on the functional activities to Atos India.

As Transition Manager I was responsible for the scope, the budget and the final implementation, including aftercare when the activities were formally transferred. The scope of these transition projects varied from 4 to 25 FTE per transition. A transition is and was nothing more than a project, hence with other milestones and deliverable (intermediate) products. The character was fixed price and fixed date. The most important point of attention in a transition was the employee that would became obsolete. These employees are the "turkey for Christmas". In general, these employees did not know whether they still had a job at the end of a transition or not. In addition, they were often unskilled in the English language and regarded the acquiring party as the evil outside world who understood nothing and the same for their own management. The crux for solving this dilemma was: 1-explain the to be obsolete employee what he will be facing when his work is gone (other job/dismissal), 2 make sure you are often together with the to be obsolete and receiving teams as much as possible and keep on checking with the individual teams.

Activities / results he has performed:
• Various Transition processes within time and budget,
• Reallocation of employees.
profile_positions.title: Transition Manager Global Sourcing for KPN

profile_positions.description:
The Service Delivery Manager (SDM) for the KPN Mobile Billing domain was temporarily given another assignment and I was asked to take over his work. The contract was executed by a team of 35 FTE in Rijswijk and 45 FTE in Groningen. During this period, the first serious start was made of moving activities to offshore locations in India. This caused a lot of fuzz among the teams. In addition, there was a re-transition of a 15-year-old test environment that had been moved to an external Indian party two years earlier and now had to go back to the Netherlands.

As SDM Frank had the responsibility for the service and operational coordination with the customer. This service consisted of maintenance tasks, Projects and Transitions.
The re-transition has cost a lot of time and effort. The causes were, among other things, that our own people in India were not allowed to enter the building of the external supplier or to connect via an external connection. When we had broken this barrier, the next barrier was already
raised. The other challenge was to keep the "frogs in the wheelbarrow". Within the teams there was a lot of fuzz about the upcoming offshore activities.

Activities / results he has performed:
• Profit and Loss responsibility,
• Re-transition of a complete test environment,
• A number of successful transitions to the Atos offshore location in India
• Managing various teams,
• Control and reporting on KPIs and SLA's.
profile_positions.title: Service Delivery Manager at KPN

profile_positions.description:
The Software Development and Maintenance Center (SDMC) was a separate unit divided into 3 technology-oriented Service Centers (Microsoft, Java and Tibco).
The SDMC was a factory concept for the development and management of applications based on fixed price and fixed date contracts.
This factory concept was based on 4 pillars, namely predictability, reliability, scalability and operational excellence. The work to be carried out within these Service Centers was 80%-95% scheduled from Atos offshore locations and 20%-5%coordinated from the Dutch front office.

As a Business Developer, Frank's work consisted of two main activities: offering fixed price offers and product management.
The quotation related to offers made by the SDMC for one of the Service Centers or quotations from the SDMC with an insourcing component. The latter form was often part of larger unit-transcending quotations with multidisciplinary teams.
As Product Manager I followed the work that was carried out in the Service Centers and carried o
ut evaluations. Best practices were formulated from the evaluations. These best practices were either efficiency succeeded that were then rolled out across all Service Centers or they were positioned as a product by which the Atos Sales Managers could go to the customers. Before these products could be positioned externally, I conducted workshops, prepared the marketing material and presented sales pitches for the Sales Managers.
As a Product Manager I was regularly asked to participate in presales activities. From Gartner and related reports, I was asked to develop new products / solutions for the Service Centers.

Activities / results he has performed:
• Creating, developing and guiding solutions for customers and the internal organization,
• Translate customer needs into implemented solutions,
• Pre-sales activities,
• Develop new solutions for potential customer groups,
• Positioning Solutions (products) for Atos Sales Managers,
• Making quotations.
profile_positions.title: Business Developer

profile_positions.description:
The Healthcare market was undergoing significant changes during this time. Health insurance companies made agreements with hospitals and other healthcare providers about Diagnosis Treatment Combinations (DBCs) for the first time. This made fixed price agreements possible with the care providers.
Perhaps even more turbulent was the development of the Electronic Patient Dossier (EPD) combined with the UZI card and the associated UZI-register (Unique Care Provider Identification register). The Nictiz, Architect and pioneer of the EPD, had a hard time and had to run an extra mile on several occasions to prevent a debacle.

As Account Manager / Business Developer, Frank was responsible for maintaining and expanding relationships and sales activities. He has done this for the Ministry of Health, Welfare and Sport (VWS), executive organizations and ZBO’s. As account manager Healthcare Public I operated in the Healthcare sales team, in which the health care providers and health insurers were also represented. Many
of the initiatives developed by the government had consequences for health care providers and health insurers. From the 2nd quarter of 2007 I was also responsible as Account Manager for the hospitals, the Ministry of Education, Culture and Science, Kennisnet and CFI.

Activities / results he has performed:
• Maintaining and expanding relationships,
• Pre-sales activities (Business Development),
• Translating customer needs into tailor-made solutions,
• Offer European tenders (Mantle and Project)
profile_positions.title: Account Manager / Business Developer

profile_positions.description:
At the beginning of the year 2000, the new Asylum Act was introduced with the aim of accelerating the asylum procedure by reducing the number of links in the existing procedure and reducing the number of statuses.
This legislation was introduced under great pressure in a short period of time and had enormous consequences for the Immigration and Naturalization Service (IND) with nearly 50,000 new asylum applications in 2000. In addition to the changes in the processes, ICT-systems also had to be adapted immediately. As a result, there was no time to maintain the documentation of the IND systems and the IND thus had very large backlogs with the system documentation of its primary systems. Because of this disadvantage, the IND-employees and hired workers were unable to adequately carry out the work on these systems.

As a Delivery Manager, Frank worked for the process to catch up on qualitative and quantitative system documentation. I have executed this project for the management of IND / GC-ICT (Ministry of Justice) for its 6 primary systems. With my team I was responsible for analyzing the available documentation as well as structuring, recording and (having supplemented) the missing parts. A difficult process as the pressure was still high to adjust the primary systems and the employees had little or no time to keep the system documentation.

Activities / results he has performed:
• Qualitative and quantitative analysis on the existing system documentation,
• Improve proposals per application,
• Supervising and controlling the implementation of the improvement proposals,
• Reporting progress to the director IND / GC-IT.
profile_positions.title: Delivery Manager at ministry of Justice (IND)

profile_positions.description:
The Public Division (Government Services) of LogicaCMG was very busy during this period with making quotations for European tenders. In addition to the fact that many mantle agreements were re-tendered, other European tenders were also in the pipeline.

In this period Frank was responsible as Bid Manager for the mantle agreements and also a number of small European tenders and a large European tender. Including a qualification and tender process for a European Tender for the outsourcing of all business information systems for the Ministry of Housing, Spatial Planning and the Environment with a contract value of more than 60 million euros. This tender was offered in collaboration with Getronics.

Activities / results he has performed:
• Coordination with internal and external parties,
• Design of a substantive offer,
• Calculation associated with the offers,
• Guiding quotes along the various internal and joint GO / NOGO decision points.
profile_positions.title: Bid Manager

profile_positions.description:
The National Crime Investigation Service (dNRI) owns the fingerprint system Havank that was used for crime investigation and the asylum chain. Havank was outdated in such a way that broken hardware could no longer be replaced and the system would not be able to function properly in due course.
The search for and comparison of fingerprints and traces was carried out by the dNRI and by the three large police forces in Amsterdam, Rotterdam and The Hague.
The dNRI did not want a 1-to-1 replacement for Havank, given the fact that the processes were outdated, the technology in the last years had made big leaps and that there was fingerprints for other activities than the detection, such as passports and foreigners.

Frank was asked by dNRI by name at the time, following his previous assignment as Project Manager at the Ministry of Justice.
The assignment he received was to make an inventory of the current requirements and wishes of the central and decentralized users, including the Asylum Services (VD) and Royal Netherlands Marechaussee (Kmar), and making a supported proposal for the future permanent situation including the organizational responsibilities.

Activities / results he has performed:
• Research and alignment with the current and desired situation,
• Research into the technical possibilities,
• Approved proposal for the future situation.
profile_positions.title: Business Consultancy at  Dutch Police (dNRI)

profile_positions.location: Ministery of Justice, The Hague Area, Netherlands
profile_positions.description:
Following the introduction of the Asylum Act and the terrorist memorandum of the Ministerial Steering Committee, it was decided that the chain partners in the Asylum chain, who supervise foreign nationals in the asylum procedure, should be provided with funds to combat identity fraud of foreign nationals.
The choice for this resource was a chip document on which a fingerprint of the foreigner is placed and equipment that can compare the fingerprint on the chip with the finger of the foreigner.
The most important chain partners for the implementation of this biometric identification equipment were the National Criminal Investigation Service (dnRI), the Foreign Services (VD) and the Royal Netherlands Marechaussee (Kmar).

This assignment involved an extensive process whereby equipment had to be installed at ± 100 locations in the Netherlands, the network infrastructure of the VD and Kmar had to be adapted, users and helpdesk employees had to be trained and a new method of identification had to be introduced. For the automated processing of fingerprints at the dNRI, systems, infrastructure and process streams needed to be adapted. Organizational responsibility had to be made to the project group, the biometrics steering group and the implementation group in which the various chain partners were represented, including the client.

To test biometric equipment in practice, I conducted a pilot together with a colleague. This was a collaboration between the Ministries of Justice and Foreign Affairs and the Kmar. At the Dutch Embassy in Accra, fingerprints were taken on a voluntary basis when applying for a Dutch visa, and a picture was taken of the face. For two months, my colleague and I compared live fingerprints and photos of passengers who traveled from Accra every working day at Schiphol in cooperation with the Kmar.
profile_positions.title: Project Manager at ministry of Justice

profile_positions.description:
After the merger between Cap Gemini and Ernst & Young, the Research & Development Institute of Cap Gemini was dissolved. Various products in progress were put on display for sale. The product Sibylle was sold to a Venture Capitalist. The product was housed in a newly established B.V. called Semergy.
Semergy was set up during the internet hype where shareholders wanted to cash in on their investments as quickly as possible. Semergy was an Internet-related company that classified and presented unstructured information.

Frank started at Semergy as Operational Manager with responsibility for the product development of the Sibylle product, the development of pre-sales activities and the company's full operational course of business. After a few months the director was dismissed and I was appointed as director Research & Development together with a Director Sales & Marketing.
The product Sibylle was sold at the time as a ready-made product that was ready for market after some small adjustments. The reality, however, was different. The product was far from market-ready, the acquired developers had been involved for a long time in executive and especially theoretical research into semantic classification and were perfectionists. Adjustments to make the product commercially available more quickly or to make it commercially more attractive encountered resistance and delay, but it was still the perfect semantic classification? Making the product ready for the market would take some time and the initial investments were not sufficient for this. In spite of this explanation, I have once again raised money from the investors to make the product ready for the market. In the end, Semergy ceased to exist at the end of 2001 and the product Sibylle was placed with one of the investors in the Anton Dreesman foundation.

Activities / results he has performed:
• Preparing the market for the product,
• Pre-sales activities,
• Profit and Loss responsibility towards the shareholders.
profile_positions.title: COO / Managing Director

profile_positions.description:
Eindhoven Airport asked Cap Gemini at the time to provide support for the year 2000 problem. Approximately 350 people worked at regional airport Eindhoven. Eindhoven Airport owned the airport platform and the terminal including facilities such as security and the flight information system. With third parties, Eindhoven Airport concludes contracts (concessions) for the provision of facilities and the commissioning of specific airport processes.

This project was realized using the Trans Millennium Risk Management method (TMR) developed by Cap Gemini. The deployment of Cap Gemini was limited to a colleague with substantive airport knowledge and myself as a project manager for 1 or 2 days a week.

Activities / results he has performed:
• Support and coaching of colleagues,
• Coordination and reporting to the client,
• Risk analysis towards client and Cap Gemini.
profile_positions.title: Project Manager / Coach at Eindhoven Airport

profile_positions.location: KPNQuest, The Hague & Amsterdam Area, the Netherlands
profile_positions.description:
KPN-Qwest was a telecommunications company that was established as a joint venture between the Dutch KPN and the American Qwest. The aim of this company was to offer services in Europe in data communication traffic, internet access, application management and support services, especially via the internet. KPN-QWest delivered data services based on Internet Protocol (IP) to its subsidiaries and external parties in at least 14 European countries. They did this with an ISP, ATM and SDH Network Operations Center, which formed the heart of KPN-Qwest. In October 1998, KPN-Qwest started the project to deal with "the year 2000 problem". The assignment was to ensure that KPN-Qwest would not be bothered during the crucial date transition (s).

Frank's assignment was to inventory all hardware and software at year 2000 compliancy and set up an emergency team for the night of the annual transition. The beauty of a joint venture is, especially in relation to "the year 2000 problem", that almost everything that is used has
 just been purchased and is therefore brand new. The downside of this was that it was difficult to make an inventory if there were more than enough liquid resources available and almost everyone within the company could order randomly and trucks with equipment were unloaded daily. For the actual annual transition, he had to arrange that KPN-Qwest personnel and external suppliers were present and / or on call to be able to deal with possible calamities adequately in accordance with pre-defined emergency plans.

Activities / results he has performed:
• Inventory of all hard- and software on year 2000 compliance,
• Coordinate plans and supervise compliance,
• Report on the progress of the compliancy.
• Establishment of emergency team for the night of the annual transition.
profile_positions.title: Process- /Project Manager at KPN-QWest

profile_positions.description:
The Cap Gemini Research & Development Institute had four pillars that were based on Cap Gemini's objectives: setting up new training, developing new products, translating client solutions into new products and guiding and supporting the competence networks. The R & D institute had around 15 permanent employees and 30-60 hired employees

Frank was employed as project manager at Cap Gemini's Research & Development Institute to support the Program Director Security and help him set up and further develop the Security competency network.
I was responsible for the product-portfolio security and the realization of a number of innovation projects for the competence development, such as Ethical Hacking. In addition, I had the task to ensure that the products from these projects and the results of client assignments could be added to Cap Gemini's portfolio.
During my assignment I was asked to make an inventory of the existing networks within Cap Gemini and to set up a back office for the 10 to 15 major competence networks and to keep this operational as responsible. This to relieve the members of these networks of project-based and logistical matters, so that they could fully engage in the substantive development of the competency areas for them and Cap Gemini.

Activities / results he has performed:
• Support Program Director Security,
• Realization of innovation projects and adding to the Cap Gemini portfolio,
• Compile and maintain Product Portfolio
• Add end results of customer projects to Cap Gemini portfolio,
• Establish a back office to support the 10 to 15 major competence networks.
profile_positions.title: Process Manager Security

profile_positions.location: Amsterdam Airport Services, Amsterdam Area, Netherlands
profile_positions.description:
Amsterdam Airport Services (Schiphol Airport) then launched a European tender for the replacement of the existing SAP system. In the role of contract manager for Cap Gemini, my role was to realize the legal and financial matters to both the subcontractors and the client in contracts.

Activities / results he has performed:
• Risk analysis,
• Create and record contract and financial agreements,
• Coordinating the legal department, supervising the contract through the internal accreditation process.
profile_positions.title: Contract Manager for Amsterdam Airport Services

profile_positions.description:
The Business Unit Methods & Tools developed Case Tool products, consisted of 3 departments: Sales, Consultancy and Product Development.
The Product Development unit had 60 products under its wing and consisted of 70 FTEs. This unit was subdivided into 6 product teams, a Quality Assurance team and a Core team responsible for the engine of these 60 products.

As Unit Manager Frank was responsible for the Product Development unit within the Business Unit Methods & Tools with an HR responsibility for 70 FTEs.
In these years we were far ahead of our time in terms of methodical software development. The development (Graphical applications with a database) happened in an iterative way in collaboration with the customer. In addition, the developers had to deliver their source code daily and this was automated tested during the night. Every developer was presented with his test results early in the morning. If there were errors in this, they had to be solved first, before other adjustments could be picked up. Every
week all products were delivered in their entirety in such a status that they could possibly be shipped to our customers.

As a Team Leader I was responsible for a number of small independent teams
(3 to 9 software engineers) and a number of products. Within these teams, usually several projects were executed linearly or iteratively. As a team leader, you were expected to be fully self-employed. This meant that I was ultimately responsible for the realization of the products, which included design, construction, testing, documentation, putting together a user team and creating user groups.

As a Software Engineer, I was employed by the SDW development team (System Development Workbench). Within this team I have carried out work as a designer, analyst, tester and programmer using, among other things, OO-techniques and the programming languages Prolog, Assembler, C and C ++.
profile_positions.title: Business unit Manager / Project-Program manager / Software Engineer

volunteer_experiences.role: Foster parents for children who have been expelled from parental authority.
volunteer_experiences.description: We where foster parents for children who have been expelled from parental authority (crisis shelter). Every child needs to grow up in a safe place, with love and structure. Unfortunately, that is not possible for some children.

volunteer_experiences.role: Senior Coach helping future entrepreneurs to develop their ideas and future companies.
volunteer_experiences.description:
As a Senior Coach helping future entrepreneurs to develop their ideas and future companies.

New Venture is an initiative of the Ministry of Economic Affairs and consultancy firm McKinsey & Company with the aim of making the Netherlands more innovative. In the past 17 years, we have assisted more than 17,500 entrepreneurs with a total of more than 7,000 business plans to help start their business. For this we have given them the necessary support in various ways; through coaching, workshops, pit-training, feedback on their plans from consultants and the jury, network meetings and our handbook.  New Venture has been able to professionalize the development of business plans and is thus at the center of entrepreneurial courses within Dutch universities, incubators
